title: Authors and Citation
text: Derek Corcoran. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Corcoran D (2024). TroublemakeR: Generates Spatial Problems R 'AMPL'. R package version 0.0.1,  https://sustainscapes.github.io/TroublemakeR/, https://github.com/Sustainscapes/TroublemakeR.
code: @Manual{,   title = {TroublemakeR: Generates Spatial Problems in R for 'AMPL'},   author = {Derek Corcoran},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.1,  https://sustainscapes.github.io/TroublemakeR/},   url = {https://github.com/Sustainscapes/TroublemakeR}, }

what: Generates Spatial Problems in R for AMPL
title: Generates Spatial Problems in R for AMPL
text: goal TroublemakeR generate r package help generate spatially explicit problems spatial data AMPL optimization software

title: Generates Spatial Problems in R for AMPL
text: can install development version TroublemakeR GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("Sustainscapes/TroublemakeR")

title: Generates Spatial Problems in R for AMPL
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(TroublemakeR) ## basic example code

what: A PackedSpatRaster of 4 species with its projected distribution for current conditions — Current
title: A PackedSpatRaster of 4 species with its projected distribution for current conditions — Current
text: PackedSpatRaster 4 species projected distribution current conditions

title: A PackedSpatRaster of 4 species with its projected distribution for current conditions — Current
code: Current

title: A PackedSpatRaster of 4 species with its projected distribution for current conditions — Current
text: Spp1 Predicted presence absence species 1 current coditions Spp2 Predicted presence absence species 1 current conditions Spp3 Predicted presence absence species 1 current conditions Spp4 Predicted presence absence species 1 current conditions

what: A PackedSpatRaster of the current landuse — CurrentLanduse
title: A PackedSpatRaster of the current landuse — CurrentLanduse
text: PackedSpatRaster current landuse

title: A PackedSpatRaster of the current landuse — CurrentLanduse
code: CurrentLanduse

title: A PackedSpatRaster of the current landuse — CurrentLanduse
text: Landuse current landuse

what: A list of 4 species with its projected distribution for 4 landuses — Species
title: A list of 4 species with its projected distribution for 4 landuses — Species
text: list 4 species projected distribution 4 landuses

title: A list of 4 species with its projected distribution for 4 landuses — Species
code: Species

what: A list of 4 Spatrasters with 4 layers each:
title: A list of 4 species with its projected distribution for 4 landuses — Species
text: Species 1 Predicted presence absence species 1 current, forest, agriculture, urban landuse Species 2 Predicted presence absence species 1 current, forest, agriculture, urban landuse Species 3 Predicted presence absence species 1 current, forest, agriculture, urban landuse Species 4 Predicted presence absence species 1 current, forest, agriculture, urban landuse

what: A list of 4 species with its projected distribution for 4 landuses — Species_Landuse
title: A list of 4 species with its projected distribution for 4 landuses — Species_Landuse
text: list 4 species projected distribution 4 landuses

title: A list of 4 species with its projected distribution for 4 landuses — Species_Landuse
code: Species_Landuse

what: A list of 4 Spatrasters with 4 layers each:
title: A list of 4 species with its projected distribution for 4 landuses — Species_Landuse
text: Species 1 Predicted presence absence species 1 forest, agriculture, urban landuse Species 2 Predicted presence absence species 1 forest, agriculture, urban landuse Species 3 Predicted presence absence species 1 forest, agriculture, urban landuse Species 4 Predicted presence absence species 1 forest, agriculture, urban landuse

title: Create budget — create_budget
text: function generates appends budget transition cost .dat file ampl. file written location specified name argument. file already exists, overwritten. file format plain text, line terminated newline character.

title: Create budget — create_budget
code: create_budget(   budget,   Rastercurrentlanduse,   landuses,   name = "Problem",   verbose = FALSE )

title: Create budget — create_budget
text: budget maximum cost problem Rastercurrentlanduse raster object current landuses landuses character vector landuses name name output file verbose Logical whether messages written function generating calculations, defaults FALSE

title: Create budget — create_budget
text: .dat file. function used side-effect writing values file.

title: Create budget — create_budget
text: Derek Corcoran

title: Create budget — create_budget
code: data(CurrentLanduse) CurrentLU <- terra::unwrap(CurrentLanduse)   TroublemakeR::create_budget(budget = 2, Rastercurrentlanduse = CurrentLU, landuses = c("Agriculture", "Forest", "Urban"), name = "Problem", verbose = TRUE) #> Landuse 1 of 3 ready 2024-03-19 11:03:00.366838 #> Landuse 2 of 3 ready 2024-03-19 11:03:00.532656 #> Landuse 3 of 3 ready 2024-03-19 11:03:00.653789  # delete the file so the test on cran can pass this  file.remove("Problem.dat") #> [1] TRUE

title: Define Cells — define_cells
text: function takes Raster object identifies non NA cells writes .dat file. file written location specified name argument. file already exists, overwritten. file format plain text, line terminated newline character.

title: Define Cells — define_cells
code: define_cells(Rasterdomain, name = "Problem")

title: Define Cells — define_cells
text: Rasterdomain Raster object value cells part problem NA values problem solved name name output file

title: Define Cells — define_cells
text: .dat file. function used side-effect writing values file.

title: Define Cells — define_cells
text: Derek Corcoran

title: Define Cells — define_cells
code: data(Species) library(terra) #> terra 1.7.71 Test <- Species[[1]] |> terra::unwrap()  # Generate the "Problem.dat" file  define_cells(Test[[1]]) #>           used (Mb) gc trigger  (Mb) max used  (Mb) #> Ncells 1557067 83.2    2887037 154.2  2322890 124.1 #> Vcells 2334282 17.9    8388608  64.0  3655759  27.9  file.remove("Problem.dat") #> [1] TRUE

title: Find connections — find_connections
text: function takes Raster object identifies non NA cells finds adjacent cells, store edges. written location specified name argument. file already exists, overwritten. file format plain text, line terminated newline character.

title: Find connections — find_connections
code: find_connections(Rasterdomain, name = "Problem", directions = "rook")

title: Find connections — find_connections
text: Rasterdomain Raster object value cells part problem NA values problem solved name name output file directions character matrix indicated directions cells considered connected. following character values allowed: "rook" "4" horizontal vertical neighbors; "bishop" get diagonal neighbors; "queen" "8" get vertical, horizontal diagonal neighbors; "16" knight one-cell queen move neighbors. directions matrix odd dimensions logical (0, 1) values

title: Find connections — find_connections
text: .dat file. function used side-effect writing values file.

title: Find connections — find_connections
text: Derek Corcoran

title: Find connections — find_connections
code: # \donttest{ library(terra) r <- rast(nrows=500, ncols=500)  set.seed(2023) values(r) <- sample(x = 1:6, size = ncell(r), replace = TRUE, prob = c(0.03125, 0.0625, 0.09375, 0.15625, 0.25, 0.40625))  ## set.seed(2023)  ForNA <- sample(1:ncell(r), ceiling(ncell(r)/10))  values(r)[ForNA] <- NA  find_connections(Rasterdomain = r, name = "Edges") file.remove("Edges.dat") #> [1] TRUE # }

title: Landuse names — landuse_names
text: function takes vector landuse names writes .dat file. file written location specified name argument. file already exists, overwritten. file format plain text, line terminated newline character.

title: Landuse names — landuse_names
code: landuse_names(landuses = NULL, name = "Problem")

title: Landuse names — landuse_names
text: landuses vector names landuses name name output file

title: Landuse names — landuse_names
text: .dat file. function used side-effect writing values file.

title: Landuse names — landuse_names
text: Derek Corcoran

title: Landuse names — landuse_names
code: landuse_names(landuses =  c("Agriculture", "Forest", "Urban")) #>           used (Mb) gc trigger  (Mb) max used  (Mb) #> Ncells 1586018 84.8    2887037 154.2  2400081 128.2 #> Vcells 2867789 21.9   10146329  77.5 10146324  77.5  # delete the file so the test on cran can pass this  file.remove("Problem.dat") #> [1] TRUE

title: Species names — species_names
text: function takes vector species names writes .dat file. file written location specified name argument. file already exists, overwritten. file format plain text, line terminated newline character.

code: species_names(species_names = NULL, name = "Problem")

title: Species names — species_names
text: species_names vector names species name name output file

title: Species names — species_names
text: .dat file. function used side-effect writing values file.

title: Species names — species_names
text: Derek Corcoran

title: Species names — species_names
code: species_names(species_names = c("Spp1", "Spp2")) #>           used (Mb) gc trigger  (Mb) max used  (Mb) #> Ncells 1586025 84.8    2887037 154.2  2400081 128.2 #> Vcells 2863947 21.9   10146329  77.5 10146324  77.5 file.remove("Problem.dat") #> [1] TRUE

title: Calculate species suitability — species_suitability
text: Calculate species suitability given raster species names writes .dat file. file written location specified name argument. file already exists, overwritten. file format plain text, line terminated newline character.

title: Calculate species suitability — species_suitability
code: species_suitability(   Rastercurrent,   species_names,   name = "Problem",   parameter = "SpeciesSuitability",   verbose = FALSE )

title: Calculate species suitability — species_suitability
text: Rastercurrent raster object current suitability species_names character vector species names name name output file parameter name parameter use verbose Logical whether messages written function generating calculations, defaults FALSE

title: Calculate species suitability — species_suitability
text: .dat file. function used side-effect writing values file.

title: Calculate species suitability — species_suitability
code: library(terra) data(Current) Current <- terra::unwrap(Current) species_suitability(Rastercurrent = Current, species_names = c("Spp1", "Spp2", "Spp3", "Spp4")) #>           used (Mb) gc trigger  (Mb) max used  (Mb) #> Ncells 1587895 84.9    2887037 154.2  2400081 128.2 #> Vcells 2867173 21.9   10146329  77.5 10146324  77.5  file.remove("Problem.dat") #> [1] TRUE

what: Calculate species suitability for each landuse — species_suitability_landuse
title: Calculate species suitability for each landuse — species_suitability_landuse
text: Calculate species suitability given raster, species names landuse writes .dat file. file written location specified name argument. file already exists, overwritten. file format plain text, line terminated newline character.

title: Calculate species suitability for each landuse — species_suitability_landuse
code: species_suitability_landuse(   Rasterspecieslanduse,   species_names,   landuses,   parameter = "SpeciesSuitabilityLanduse",   name = "Problem",   verbose = FALSE )

title: Calculate species suitability for each landuse — species_suitability_landuse
text: Rasterspecieslanduse list species suitability landuse species_names character vector species names landuses character vector landuses parameter name parameter use name name output file verbose Logical whether messages written function generating calculations, defaults FALSE

title: Calculate species suitability for each landuse — species_suitability_landuse
text: .dat file. function used side-effect writing values file.

title: Calculate species suitability for each landuse — species_suitability_landuse
code: library(terra) data("Species_Landuse") Species_Landuse <- Species_Landuse |> purrr::map(terra::unwrap) species_suitability_landuse(Rasterspecieslanduse = Species_Landuse, species_names = c("Spp1", "Spp2", "Spp3", "Spp4"), landuses = c("Agriculture", "Forest", "Urban"), name = "Test") file.remove("Test.dat") #> [1] TRUE

title: Troublemaker — troublemaker
text: function metafunction several functions inside takes several spatial objects generates .dat file spatial dataset AMPL

title: Troublemaker — troublemaker
code: troublemaker(   Rasterdomain = NULL,   Rastercurrent = NULL,   species_names = NULL,   Rasterspecieslanduse = NULL,   landuses = NULL,   budget = NULL,   Rastercurrentlanduse = NULL,   directions = NULL,   name = "Problem",   verbose = FALSE )

title: Troublemaker — troublemaker
text: Rasterdomain Raster object value cells part problem NA values problem solved Rastercurrent raster object current suitability species_names vector names species Rasterspecieslanduse list species suitability landuse landuses character vector landuses budget maximum cost problem Rastercurrentlanduse raster object current landuses directions just adjacent character matrix indicated directions cells considered connected. following character values allowed: "rook" "4" horizontal vertical neighbors; "bishop" get diagonal neighbors; "queen" "8" get vertical, horizontal diagonal neighbors; "16" knight one-cell queen move neighbors. directions matrix odd dimensions logical (0, 1) values name name output file verbose Logical whether messages written function generating calculations, defaults FALSE

title: Troublemaker — troublemaker
text: .dat file spatial problem formated AMPL. function used side-effect writing values file.

title: Troublemaker — troublemaker
text: Derek Corcoran

title: Troublemaker — troublemaker
code: # Example 1 with current suitabilities data(Species) data(Current) library(terra) Test <- Species[[1]] |> terra::unwrap()  Current <- terra::unwrap(Current)  # Generate the "Problem.dat" file  TroublemakeR::troublemaker(Rasterdomain =Test[[1]], Rastercurrent = Current, species_names = c("Spp1", "Spp2", "Spp3", "Spp4"), name = "Problem")  # delete the file so the test on cran can pass this  file.remove("Problem.dat") #> [1] TRUE  # Example 2 with landuse suitabilities  data(Species) data("Species_Landuse")  library(terra) Test <- Species[[1]] |> terra::unwrap()  Species_Landuse <- Species_Landuse |> purrr::map(terra::unwrap)  # Generate the "Problem2.dat" file  TroublemakeR::troublemaker(Rasterdomain =Test[[1]], Rasterspecieslanduse = Species_Landuse, species_names = c("Spp1", "Spp2", "Spp3", "Spp4"), landuses = c("Agriculture", "Forest", "Urban"), name = "Problem2")  # delete the file so the test on cran can pass this  file.remove("Problem2.dat") #> [1] TRUE   # Example 3 with budget and transition cost   data("CurrentLanduse")  CurrentLU <- terra::unwrap(CurrentLanduse)  TroublemakeR::troublemaker(Rasterdomain =Test[[1]],  Rasterspecieslanduse = Species_Landuse,  species_names = c("Spp1", "Spp2", "Spp3", "Spp4"),  landuses = c("Agriculture", "Forest", "Urban"),  Rastercurrentlanduse = CurrentLU,  budget = 2,  name = "Problem3",  verbose = FALSE) #>           used (Mb) gc trigger  (Mb) max used  (Mb) #> Ncells 1590217   85    2887037 154.2  2591282 138.4 #> Vcells 2872713   22   10146329  77.5 10146324  77.5   file.remove("Problem3.dat") #> [1] TRUE

title: Writes an AMPL line — write_ampl_lines
text: function takes character writes .dat file. file written location specified name argument. file already exists, overwritten. file format plain text, line terminated newline character.

title: Writes an AMPL line — write_ampl_lines
code: write_ampl_lines(line, name = "Problem")

title: Writes an AMPL line — write_ampl_lines
text: line line written .dat file name name output file

title: Writes an AMPL line — write_ampl_lines
text: .dat file. function used side-effect writing values file.

title: Writes an AMPL line — write_ampl_lines
code: write_ampl_lines("param s:= 1")  file.remove("Problem.dat") #> [1] TRUE

title: Write cell parameters — write_cell_param
text: function takes Raster object, uses values parameter writes .dat file. file written location specified name argument. file already exists, overwritten. file format plain text, line terminated newline character.

title: Write cell parameters — write_cell_param
code: write_cell_param(   Rasterparam,   parameter,   default = NULL,   name = "Problem",   verbose = FALSE )

title: Write cell parameters — write_cell_param
text: Rasterparam Raster object values parameter parameter name parameter use default value default value parameter one, otherwise keep NULL name name output file verbose Logical whether messages written function generating calculations, defaults FALSE

title: Write cell parameters — write_cell_param
text: .dat file. function used side-effect writing values file.

title: Write cell parameters — write_cell_param
code: library(terra)  A <- TroublemakeR::Current |> terra::unwrap() A <- A[[1]]  write_cell_param(Rasterparam = A, parameter = "Suitability", name = "Problem")   write_cell_param(Rasterparam = A, parameter = "Carbon", default = 1,  name = "Problem")   write_cell_param(Rasterparam = A, parameter = "Cost", default = 0,  name = "Problem")   file.remove("Problem.dat") #> [1] TRUE
